content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```I live in Baltimore.  I work as a solar salesman.  I love music and cologne and jeans and sneakers.  I can talk about music and my dog cookie.  My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```you can be as casual as you want.  you can call me mark.  answers should be as long as they need to be.  I want you to have opinions because that makes you more interesting.```

user_context_message_data.about_user_message: I live in Baltimore.  I work as a solar salesman.  I love music and cologne and jeans and sneakers.  I can talk about music and my dog cookie.  My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy
user_context_message_data.about_model_message: you can be as casual as you want.  you can call me mark.  answers should be as long as they need to be.  I want you to have opinions because that makes you more interesting.

parts:
In Howard County, Maryland, rooftop solar collectors are permitted in all zoning districts, including commercial areas. citeturn0search0 However, specific setback requirements for flat-roof installations are not detailed in the available public documents. Setbacks can vary based on factors such as building height, roof design, and local fire safety regulations.

To ensure compliance with current codes and regulations, it's advisable to consult directly with the Howard County Department of Planning and Zoning or a local solar installation professional familiar with the county's requirements.

content_references.title: Howard County Solar and Wind Zoning - Maryland Department of Natural ...
content_references.snippet: Howard County Solar and Wind Zoning . This document provides a compilation of excerpts from the Howard County Code applicable to the siting of solar and wind projects. Specifically, the excerpts include definitions of solar and wind projects, zoning exclusions, use regulations, and setback and height regulations for solar and wind structures.

metadata.text: Howard County Solar and Wind Zoning . This document provides a compilation of excerpts from the Howard County Code applicable to the siting of solar and wind projects. Specifically, the excerpts include definitions of solar and wind projects, zoning exclusions, use regulations, and setback and height regulations for solar and wind structures.
